page.title: 16RAINHAM COUNTRY PARK
page.content: By the {River Medway} is {Gillingham Country Par}k.It covers a strip of foreshore about 2 miles long,and up to 100 meters wide.It is mostly wild grassland and saltings,with good views over the river. {Berengrave Nature Reserve} is a disused chalkpit which remains of an old wash mill.A very rare plant is the {Round Leaved Wintergreen}.There is a pool which shelters a lot of water birds such as the {Coot,Moorhen,Little Grebe and Reed Warbler}.There are 2 main types of {Reed},the {Phragmites} and the {Typha}.Around the pool grow many {Buddleia} bushes,a favourite food for butterflies.The {Carr}or damp woodland is flooded in winter.The {Holm Oak} is the home of {Jays}.The nature reserve is a quiet and peaceful place and we felt we were in the countryside.
